com.here.sdk.mapviewlite

Class MapViewLite

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.FrameLayout
          • com.here.sdk.mapviewlite.MapViewLite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent

    public class MapViewLite
extends android.widget.FrameLayout
    A view that can display a map.

    Internally, MapViewLite uses a SurfaceView for rendering. It is possible to instantiate MapViewLite with a zOrderOnTop custom layout attribute by adding custom:setZOrderOnTop="true" to your map view layout. By default, it is set to false. When setting the attribute, make sure to bind the custom namespace to your layout root: xmlns:custom="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto".

    Map tiles caching

    The map tiles cache stores the map data the user sees on the screen. It's mostly used for speeding up the startup times, but it has an additional advantage of showing cached map content, when a device looses connectivity. The map tiles cache stores all visible map data, which, apart from vector tiles, includes traffic, satellite and raster data.

    The maximum tiles cache size is defined by SDKOptions.cacheSizeInBytes. You can set it in the app's manifest file or when SDKOptions and SDKNativeEngine are created programmatically. Please refer to the developer's guide for more information about how to do that.

    The default value is 256 MB. Use 0 value, if you want to disable the caching at all. Already cached tiles are not going to be evicted, if the cache is disabled. If you want to use cache size other than default and you don't define it in the manifest file, you have to set it every time a SDKOptions instance is created.

    The tiles cache is stored under SDKOptions.cachePath (which by default is the application's standard internal cache location Context.getCacheDir()) under the subdirectory <Cache Version>/<Access Key ID>/mapviewlite-tiles. Standard Android cache management rules are applied to the default tiles cache path. This includes no permissions need and cache quota rules. For details please refer to the Android documentation (a good starting point to refer to: Access app-specific files. The maximum cache size is not limited internally by the SDK. Once an app is removed from a user's device the cache is also deleted, unless the cache path was changed to an external one.

    If the tiles cache becomes full, the oldest tiles are replaced with the newest tiles. Changing the maximum cache size between consecutive application launches does not necessarily invalidate currently cached tiles. When the maximum cache size is increased, already saved tiles are not removed. However when it's decreased, the oldest tiles may be eventually evicted (depending on the cache fullness) and the effective cache size will be trimmed to the selected maximum cache size. If the cache is disabled (by setting the maximum cache size to 0), then saved tiles are not removed, but remain unused until you reenable the cache. If you want to remove all already cached tiles, call MapViewLite.clearTilesCache(). If you want to get the current cache size, call MapViewLite.getTilesCacheSize().

      • setEGLContextFactory

        public void setEGLContextFactory(android.opengl.GLSurfaceView.EGLContextFactory factory)
        Optionally sets a custom EGLContextFactory to GLSurfaceView. To have an effect this must be called before onCreate.

      • clearTilesCache

        public void clearTilesCache()
        Clears the entire persistent tiles cache. See MapViewLite documentation to find out more details about tiles caching.

      • getTilesCacheSize

        public long getTilesCacheSize()
        Returns the size in bytes of the data currently stored in the tiles cache. It should be called after onCreate otherwise it always returns 0. See MapViewLite documentation to find out more details about tiles caching.
        Returns:
        The size in bytes of the data currently stored in the tiles cache.

      • getMapScene

        public MapScene getMapScene()
        Gets map scene associated with this view. It is used to initialize and change the contents of the map that is displayed by this map view.
        Returns:
        A map scene associated with this map view.

      • getCamera

        public Camera getCamera()
        Gets camera for this map view.
        Returns:
        An instance of Camera.

      • pickMapItems

        public void pickMapItems(@NonNull
                         Point2D centerPoint,
                         double radius,
                         @NonNull
                         PickMapItemsCallback callback)

        Returns all map items located inside the specified pick area. The pick area is a circle defined by a center point and radius.

        Parameters:
        centerPoint -

        The center point of the pick area, in view coordinates in pixels.

        radius -

        The radius of the pick area, in pixels.

        callback -

        Callback to call with the result. This will be called on main thread when the operation has completed.

                          MapOverlay<?> overlay)

        Parameters:

                             MapOverlay<?> overlay)

        overlay - MapOverlay to remove.

      • setWatermarkPosition

        public void setWatermarkPosition(WatermarkPlacement placement,
                                 int bottomCenterMargin)
        Sets the HERE logo watermark location within the map view. Defaults to WatermarkPlacement.BOTTOM_RIGHT. It is recommended to change the default placement only when it is required due to overlapping UI elements.
        Parameters:
        placement - Placement of HERE logo watermark. For more details please see WatermarkPlacement.
        bottomCenterMargin - An optional margin for the bottom-center position measured in pixels from the map's bottom side. Ignored when the bottom-left or bottom-right placement is used.
